title: National Government Services Portal
description: National Government Services Portal of India provides single window access to services offered by the various Indian Government entities. This Portal is an initiative under the India Portal Project and has been designed and developed by National Informatics Centre (NIC), Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology, Government of India.

items.title: Raise Grievance for Vehicle High Security Registration Plate
items.description: This portal helps vehicle owners raise grievances related to High Security Registration Plates (HSRP). Users can select their state, describe their issue, and submit complaints regarding booking, fitment, payment, or delivery. The grievance redressal system ensures prompt resolution and enhances user satisfaction by maintaining transparency and efficiency in managing HSRP-related concerns and feedback.

items.title: File and Track your Grievances related to Government Services Chennai, Tamil Nadu
items.description: Mudhalvarin Mugavari Department is an inclusive, integrated and convenient public grievance redressal platform, where you can File your grievance via multiple channels – calling the helpline, web portal, mobile app, e-mail, Twitter, Facebook, by post or by visiting the grievance call center in person.

items.title: Apply Complaints and Grievance for Gandhinagar Municipal Corporation, Gujarat
items.description: Register and Track Compliant for Categories like Water and Drainage Related, Streetlight, Garbage and Sanitation, Road Repair and Man-Hole Related Problem and so on.

items.title: Valuable Feedback on Population Management Policy, Andhra Pradesh
items.description: The portal invites valuable feedback and suggestions from citizens on the Population Management Policy of Andhra Pradesh. It aims to promote participatory governance by encouraging public involvement in shaping strategies for sustainable population growth, resource management, and socio-economic development. Through this platform, individuals can share insights, recommendations, and perspectives to help the government enhance policy effectiveness and ensure a balanced approach toward health, welfare,...

items.title: Complaint Registration for India Post
items.description: The India Post Complaint Registration portal provides a convenient platform for customers to register and track complaints related to postal services, including mail delivery, parcels, money orders, and other services. This digital grievance redressal system ensures prompt resolution by connecting customers directly with concerned authorities. Users can submit complaints, check status updates, and receive timely responses. The initiative reflects India Post’s commitment to enhancing customer satisfaction...

items.title: Resolve Your Property Issues With Bangalore Development Authority, Karnataka
items.description: This platform provides a user-friendly mechanism for citizens to raise and resolve issues related to Bangalore Development Authority (BDA) services. Residents can register complaints, track their status, and receive timely responses from the concerned departments. It promotes transparency and accountability by ensuring that grievances about housing, property, or development-related matters are addressed efficiently, offering a hassle-free way for citizens to communicate with BDA and seek redressal...

items.title: List of Nodal Public Grievance Officers
items.description: This resource provides an official list of Nodal Public Grievance Officers designated across ministries and departments. Citizens can refer to this list to identify the correct authority for submitting appeals or grievances. The availability of such information enhances transparency, ensures accountability, and streamlines redressal processes by directing concerns to responsible officers. It empowers individuals to seek timely resolution of their issues and strengthens the grievance management system...

items.title: Login for Trial Monitoring System by Bihar Police, Bihar
items.description: The Trial Monitoring System &#40;TMS&#41; by Bihar Police is a digital platform designed to monitor and track the progress of trials and judicial proceedings. Authorized users can log in to access detailed case information, updates, and timelines for better coordination between police and judiciary. This system enhances accountability, ensures faster case follow-ups, and reduces delays in legal processes. By providing transparency and structured monitoring, the TMS contributes to strengthening...

items.title: Send Feedback Mukh Mantri Punjab Cancer Raahat Kosh, Punjab
items.description: This portal invites citizens to share valuable feedback on the Mukh Mantri Punjab Cancer Raahat Kosh initiative. Users can submit suggestions, concerns, or experiences to improve the effectiveness of services provided under this health relief scheme. The feedback mechanism ensures transparency, promotes accountability, and encourages citizen participation in strengthening the program. It allows the government to better address patient needs, enhance support systems, and refine service delivery, thereby...

items.title: Check Grievance Application Status, Andhra Pradesh
items.description: To check the status of a grievance application in Andhra Pradesh, citizens can utilize the Spandana platform, an online portal for grievance redressal. Spandana allows citizens to register grievances through various channels like the GSWS, 1902 Call Center, mobile app, web application, and during collectorate grievance days (Spandana Monday). To check the status, citizens need their grievance registration number or other relevant details.

items.title: Online Complaints for Water Supply and Sewerage, Punjab
items.description: Punjab residents can file online complaints regarding water supply and sewerage issues through the official Punjab government portal or the respective municipal corporation websites. These platforms allow citizens to report problems like water leakage and sewage oerflow.

items.title: Court Case Monitoring System, Bihar
items.description: The Bihar Court Case Monitoring System &#40;CCMS&#41; is a digital platform designed to streamline and track legal workflows within government departments. It enables departments to monitor court cases, ensure timely follow-ups, and improve inter-departmental coordination, ultimately reducing case backlogs and enhancing legal compliance.

items.title: Online FIR Status Search, Haryana
items.description: The Haryana Police offers an online facility for citizens to check the status of their First Information Report (FIR). This service allows users to search for FIR details by entering specific information such as the FIR number, year, and the concerned police station. It ensures transparency and provides easy access to case updates without the need to visit a police station. The platform is part of Haryana Police’s digital initiative to enhance public convenience and trust.

items.title: Citizens Online Inform Police, Haryana
items.description: The Haryana Police provides an online service for citizens to report information related to crimes. Users can fill out forms detailing the nature of the incident, personal information, and suspect details. This platform enhances transparency and enables the public to share important information with law enforcement conveniently and securely, supporting community safety and crime prevention efforts.

items.title: Apply for RTI (Right to Information Act 2005), Punjab
items.description: The Right to Information (RTI) Act, 2005 empowers citizens to seek timely access to government information. Punjab residents can use this online portal to file RTI applications and appeals. It provides access to key details such as Public Information Officers (PIOs), First Appellate Authorities, and other RTI disclosures. Developed under the Department of Personnel and Training, this platform enhances transparency and accountability by facilitating quick and easy access to public information across...

items.title: Student Register Grievance on Education Portal, Madhya Pradesh
items.description: Students in Madhya Pradesh can submit complaints or concerns online through the Education Portal's grievance system. Fill in the required details and submit your issue digitally. This system ensures transparency, quick resolution, and improved educational services through feedback and grievance redressal.

items.title: Apply for Legal Aid for Women Victims of Dowry Practice, Uttar Pradesh
items.description: Women affected by dowry-related issues can seek free legal assistance through this scheme. The initiative helps victims access justice and legal support against dowry harassment.

items.title: Application for Complaint about Atrocities, Uttar Pradesh
items.description: Citizens facing atrocities can report their grievances online through the Uttar Pradesh government’s portal. The system ensures prompt action against discrimination, violence, or any other form of injustice.

items.title: PMO Grievance Portal
items.description: The PMO Grievance Portal is an online platform that allows Indian citizens to submit grievances related to government services and policies directly to the Prime Minister’s Office. It provides a transparent and efficient mechanism for addressing public concerns.

items.title: Check Complaint Status in Real Estate Regulatory Authority, Karnataka
items.description: Consumers who have filed complaints with Karnataka RERA can track the progress of their grievances through this online service. The portal provides real-time updates on the status of complaints, including the latest actions taken by the authority, hearing schedules, and resolutions. This service ensures transparency in handling real estate-related issues, allowing complainants to stay informed about the progress of their cases.
